titlestmt.titleproper: Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Winthrop Rockefeller papers, Series AD
A Guide to the Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Winthrop Rockefeller papers, Series AD FA403
titlestmt.author: Bethany J. Antos

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-06-01 00:48:01 -0400.

did.unittitle: Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Winthrop Rockefeller papers, Series AD

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into four groups, primarily based on subject matter:

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Rockefeller Archive Center holds title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use". If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection, or items within a collection, it is the users' responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For materials that complement or enhance an understanding of Winthrop Rockefeller's life and work, researchers may wish to consult the following collections at the Rockefeller Archive Center:

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was collected by Rockefeller Family and Associates (Room 5600) and later transferred to the Rockefeller Archive Center by Room 5600.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: correspondence, speeches, and publications.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Family and Personal is arranged roughly alphabetically, and includes materials related to Winthrop's personal life, including correspondence and clippings maintained by the Rockefeller Family Office.

Estate of Winthrop Rockefeller (Office Furniture - Tower Building - Little Rock, Arkansas, 467 Via Lola, Palm Springs, California, Cal-Ceram, Inc.)

Winthrop Rockefeller, Death, Press Release and Memorial Service Program

Winthrop Rockefeller, Finances, Mr. R., Jr. Chase Bank and Morgan Loans
Separation Agreement and Property Settlement, Winthrop and Bobo Rockefeller

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Winrock Farms is arranged alphabetically and contains items related to the Farm, mostly publicity material on the annual cattle production sales at Winrock Farms.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Speeches, Publications, and Publicity Materials is arranged alphabetically, and made up of several boxes of speeches made by Winthrop from 1937 through 1967, as well as publications by or about Winthrop Rockefeller. The majority of these materials were generated during Withrop's campaigns for Arkansas governor or during his governorships.

did.unittitle: "A Farewell Address" by Governor Winthrop Rockefeller
Draft of Doubleday Book by Winthrop Rockefeller
"Executive Clemency and the Death Penalty," "The Catholic University Law Review"
"Here I Stand...on Civil Rights / Education / Labor / Welfare"

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 2 business days, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may be restricted at the discretion of RAC.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center recognizes that our audiovisual materials may contain problematic language and/or content.

The films, videos, and/or sound in this collection have not been altered in any way. All titles and/or content are illustrative of the creator's original vision. As such, this audiovisual collection may contain discriminatory visual and/or aural content that is representative of racial, gendered, or ableist biases.

Accompanying description, most often with creator or donor-generated language and terminology, has to this point been retained and maintained "as received" by RAC with minimal archivist intervention or augmentation.
We acknowledge these problems and aim to cultivate inclusive representation and equity by reconsidering and enhancing our description of this audiovisual material with current sensibilities.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arkansas: building and development of Winrock Farms; Santa Gertrudis cattle breeding program; obtaining water supply for farm; Winthrop Rockefeller's daily schedule; building local school and clinic; Petitjean Airport; Winthrop Rockefeller's personal reflections on the Arkansas Industrial Development Commission; film written and narrated by Walter McGraw

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Overview of Arkansas cattle breeding programs and construction of Winrock Farm, written and narrated by Walter McGraw.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy available.
